textBodys.text: The insulin that you are using can be kept at room temperature for 28 days
It is important to keep it away from a radiator or direct sunlight
The insulin that you are not using needs to be kept in the fridge
When you are on holiday in a hot country, you will need to keep your insulin cool
When you are collect your insulin from the pharmacy, it is important to check that you have been given the correct insulin as the strength of insulin can vary and that it has come from the fridge
It is important to check the insulin is still in date and that the vial has not broken or leakin
Check that the insulin is clear and has not crystallised
